direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods retrieve elements from the queue but with different behaviors (element throws an exception if the queue is empty, while peek returns null).
Both methods interact with the queue's elements, but poll removes the element from the queue while element only retrieves it.
Both methods involve synchronized access to the queue and interaction with its elements, but offer adds an element while element retrieves one.
Both methods interact with the queue's elements, but remove retrieves and removes the element from the queue while element only retrieves it.
Both methods involve synchronized access to the queue and comparison operations, but equals compares the queue with another object while element retrieves an element.
Both methods involve synchronized access to the queue and return a value based on the queue's state, but hashCode computes a hash code while element retrieves an element.
